questions.prompt: What is the primary function of a Half Adder?
options: To add three bits
To add two integers
To accept two input bits and generate two outputs (a sum bit and a carry bit)
To convert each of its BCD inputs to corresponding Excess-3 Code
questions.explanation: A Half Adder is a combinational circuit that accepts two input bits and generates two outputs (a sum bit and a carry bit).

questions.prompt: What is the difference between a Full Adder and a Half Adder?
questions.answer: A Full Adder is a combinational circuit that performs the arithmetic sum of three input bits (augend, addend, and carry-in) and generates two outputs (a sum and a carry-out), whereas a Half Adder only accepts two input bits.

questions.prompt: What is the purpose of the BCD-to-Excess-3 Converter?
options: To convert each of its binary inputs to corresponding BCD code
To convert each of its BCD inputs to corresponding Excess-3 Code
To add two integers
To accept two input bits and generate two outputs (a sum bit and a carry bit)
questions.explanation: The BCD-to-Excess-3 Converter is designed to convert each of its BCD inputs to corresponding Excess-3 Code.

questions.prompt: What is the function of the Incrementer (Inc16) chip?
questions.answer: The Incrementer (Inc16) chip is a digital circuit that inputs a 16-bit integer and adds 1 to it, ignoring the carry out from the MSb (if any).

questions.prompt: What is the primary function of a Binary Adder?
options: To convert each of its BCD inputs to corresponding Excess-3 Code
To accept two input bits and generate two outputs (a sum bit and a carry bit)
To produce the sum of two n-bit binary numbers
To add three bits
questions.explanation: A Binary Adder is a digital circuit that produces the sum of two n-bit binary numbers.

questions.prompt: What is the purpose of the Full Subtractor chip?
questions.answer: The Full Subtractor chip is a combinational circuit that performs the arithmetic subtraction of three input bits (minuend, subtrahend, and borrow-in) and generates two outputs (a difference and a borrow-out).

questions.prompt: What is the function of the Xor gate in the Half Adder chip?
options: To generate the carry bit
To generate the sum bit
To convert each of its BCD inputs to corresponding Excess-3 Code
To add two integers
questions.explanation: The Xor gate in the Half Adder chip is used to generate the sum bit.

questions.prompt: What is the difference between a Combinational Circuit and a Sequential Circuit?
questions.answer: A Combinational Circuit is a digital circuit whose output is a function of the current input only, whereas a Sequential Circuit is a digital circuit whose output is a function of the current input and the previous output.

questions.prompt: What is the purpose of the HDL (Hardware Description Language) file?
options: To convert each of its BCD inputs to corresponding Excess-3 Code
To simulate the behavior of a digital circuit
To design a combinational circuit
To load the HDL file into the hardware simulator
questions.explanation: The HDL file is loaded into the hardware simulator to simulate the behavior of a digital circuit.
